stanza.line: Be wise as thou art cruel do not (a)press(/a)
My tongue-tied patience with too much (b)disdain(/b)
Lest sorrow lend me words and words (a)express(/a)
If I might teach thee wit better it (c)were(/c)
Though not to love yet love to tell me (d)so(/d)
As testy sick men when their deaths be (c)near(/c)
No news but health from their physicians (d)know(/d)
For if I should despair I should grow (e)mad(/e)
And in my madness might speak ill of (f)thee(/f)
Now this ill-wresting world is grown so (e)bad(/e)
Mad slanderers by mad ears believed (f)be(/f)
That I may not be so nor thou (g)belied(/g)
Bear thine eyes straight though thy proud heart go (g)wide(/g)
